text: Excellent Dark color Beer with aroma & taste thats #1. WhatCmore can I say, for me this is my #1 amongst the others I tried. #Muy excellente.!!!
Bottle at hotel in Costa Rica. Enjoyable here, but at home this would not suffice. Light exotic fruits, some bitterness and caramel. Ok, I guess,
Buenas notas de lupulo y caramelo. Tiene un gran cuerpo y amarga pero esta muy balanceado... Hay que probarla!
(330ml bottle) Pours a clear amber body with a medium off-white head. Aroma of caramel, grain, grass, mustiness, and florals. Flavor of caramel, grain, toffee, and citrus.

bottle @luv burger in samara; at the time of tasting this was the number one ranked beer in costa rica. rich shade of copper with a small pancake dough head and decent lacing; aroma of northwest hops, some amarillo, very pellet-y; plenty of toffeed sweetness, hints of hay; modest bitterness but quite agreeable
12oz bottle. Aroma is earth, toasted malts and mild caramel. The flavor is toasted malts, fruit, light citrus hops, mild sweetness/sugar notes and a lightly bitter/tart finish. Not bad.
Drakes 10k. Medium amber. Weird aroma of bready yeast and dusty hops. Flavor matches. But kinda hated this. Just strange, and not in a good way. Not sure what was happening here.
A bit vegetal aroma. Clear copper, medium head. Grain. Medium body, moderate carbonation.
Bottle at tasting. Caramel with foamy head and nice lacing. Also smells like garbage. Sweet and wheaty.
Bottle at Drake 10k tasting. Clear golden amber color, fluffy white head. Aroma of caramel and bread crust. Taste is papery caramel. Interesting.

Everyone is right, this is one incredible beer. It is bitter, so in my opinion not for any occasion. It leaves a very pleasant taste in your mouth. Smells very good. Very well done. Probably the best beer in Costa Rica. Hard to find.

12 ounce bottle pours a nice amber red with a hazy head, sampled in Sámara Costa Rica. one of the best craft beers I have tried anywhere in Central America. nice hops and a bit of sweet malt in the finish. Would and have drunk again
user_location: The World of Beer, Texas, USA

text: Bottle shared at a tasting. Pours a clear red with a thin fizzy white head. Fair head retention. Aroma of nuts, toffee, grain. The taste is stone fruits, nuts, grain, toffee. Thin bodied.
Appearance: a deep copper color with a medium head. Aroma: a nice hoppy aroma and bready presence. Taste: tastes like toasty malts and has a good bitternes. Nice balanced beer. On tap at El Gaff.

A hazed reddish brown ale with a thick frothy mocha head. In aroma, sweet caramel malt with light grassy hops and butterscotch notes, light fruity notes, banana, OK. In mouth, a smooth sweet fruity caramel malt with light grassy hops, butterscotch, light burned caramel, nice and refreshing. Bottle from La Bodega de Chema.

Color rojizo, buena carbonatacion, buena espuma pero poco estable, con aromas a cebada tostada que se opacan por el lupulo. Amargo remanente que opaca un poco el resto de los sabores. Le falta algo de cuerpo. Una Ale muy ligera. El amargo le quita drinkability. Botella en bar @ San Jose

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Keg at Hotel Belmar, Monteverde.  Clear amber, small head. Bready nose with roses and grapefruit. Mid dry with light-medium body and clean, rounded mouthfeel. Crystal malt and toast, slight citrus hops. Mid bittet finish. Nicely balanced.
Dark reddish pour from draft at Los Amigos in Jaco Costa Rica. White foamy head. Smokey Carmel aroma. Earthy and malty Carmel taste. Seems thick. Not bad. Not great
Pours a nice caramel red, very nice hoppy/malty aroma for the style. Almost comes off like a pale ale with how hoppy I found it. Best youll find in this country
on tap at volcano brewery in tilaran. poured a cloudy light orange. aroma of hops and a little nutty. taste was very smooth. had a yeast and alcohol after taste.

This is our first night in Costa Rica and the hotel market had this in the cooler, so we tasted a couple of bottles. This opens with a fragrant hoppy aroma and finishes with a balanced malt and hoppy bitterness. A nice find in a country not known for its craft beers.

Tried in Costa Rica, Puerto Viejo. Purchased at Supermercado Diamante; 355ml bottle for 1,200 colones (= $2.40). Brewery: Costa Ricas Craft Brewing Company, Cartgo, Costa Rica. Beer: Segua. Style: Irish Red Ale. IBU: 37. ABV: 5%Colour: medium copper. Head: short. Aroma: slightly malty (like a red ale). Taste: same as aroma. Summary: well-made but a bit lacking in character.
Poured from a bottle, thanks to Craig. Notes that are  caramely, hoppy, bitter, floral, bready. Not bad.

Bottle thanks to the true Costa Rican hook up, gracias Cecilia and Craig. Pours a deep copper color with a medium white head. A nice crisp nose of caramel and hops.Floral hop flavors, some caramel, very easygoing and clean. Tasty.
Nice red pour with a khaki head, good clarity.  Aroma of toasty malts, a touch of hops, bread.  Toasty and biscuit flavors, slight sweetness, nice hop balance.  Nice brew.

Deep gold, hazy, white head. Toasty malt, spicy hops, grainy finish with some lingering bitterness. 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Smells pretty hoppy. Pours clear orange with good lacing. Long lasting head. Taste is bitter with a note of sweetness. Nice soft carbonation. Some citrus peel in aroma. Bottle at Quijongos.

330ml bottle from the brewery 
Appearance: Pours clear dark golden with a medium sized off-white head that leaves good lacing as it slowly dissipates 
Aroma: Caramel, grapefruit and bready 
Taste: Toasted malts, caramel, citrus with a mild bitterness in the finish 
A nice mild Red Ale, crisp and clean.

The pour: on tap, ruby or copper in colour with thin white head. Nice lacing. The aroma: very hoppy (particularly for Costa Rica), a nice pine with citrus rind and a few metallic notes. The taste: full bodied with a bold bitterness. Finishes dry. The verdict: another great find from CRs CBC.

A very good red ale.  Not too bitter and has an AMAZING aroma.  I really wish this beer was available I the US. I would drink it very often if it were. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A good red. Pours dark golden with white head. Smell is great, hint of bananas. Taste is good, a little fruity, slightly creamy, with a hippy aftertaste. Had on tap at Volcano Brewing Company in Costa Rica.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

draft.  deep chestnut brown / red body.  its a husky and slightly toasty red malt showcase: the toasted barley is crunchy and forward, it thankfully leans to the dry side, is kept very much in balance by a mild sweetness across the middle and ample American hop bitterness and fruitiness late.  well-made.

33cl bottle transported to Europe from Gods own country by a Thirsty Pilgrim.  Drinking this in Costa Rica must take you a step closer to paradise but even in the Cambridgeshire fen it kicks some butt, or rather cask.  Orange-red, clear and clean, with an understated hop but barley-rich and highly drinkable.  Craft beer knocks off its 55th country.
Bottle: first beer on my trip to Costa Rica. having traveled in central America before I am shocked to see a craft beer. This has a nice hoppy bite to it but isnt overpowering.

Certainly a different beer to what is massively produced in CR. With its thicker hoppier taste it appeals to be the bitter beer lover in some of us.
perfect  match with seafood and cold nights

Ahora si..! siento una verdadera, unica y profunda cerveza  y hecha en Costa Rica..?  despues de probar la Segua..me recuerda mucho mis salidas nocturnas fuera del campus y visitar con las amigas nuestro pub preferido, donde la imaginacion, la presentacion se llena en cada pinta a probar de una barra de selectas cervezas artesanales (por supuesto no aqui)...Me llamo mucho la atencion del logo (al igual que Libertas), se presta para la conversacion y la tiene..aromas a masa madre (sourdough), floral, de un color profundo, efervescente. Sabor amargo, a cerveza artesanal con una espuma que merece producirla en cada sorbo con una ligera movida direccional del vaso. Simplemente no es posible de solo tomarse una...
Draft: Very nice malt & hop balance could easily be an American Pale Ale. Sweetness with herbal hop taste. Food Pairing: Buffalo Chicken Sandwich.

Red Amber color with creamy head.  Middle carbonation.   Aroma has fruity notes that mix with caramel and hops.  The flavor is good balance of sweet malt, caramel and hops with a crispy end.  You can taste more of its profile as it gets a bit warmer.   Thanks to the good guys of Costa Rican Craft Brewing company for this beer.

The Time Out Tavern in Escazú appears to be selling the hell out of this stuff. I was told by the owner that people are just looking for something different, i.e. in a color other than yellow, and that he could sell the heck out of a porter or stout if they made one. Does that mean the future is dark or bright or both? The Segua is physically attractive, with a mildly hoppy nose that was not quite as big as I wanted it to be. But it rarely is. The flavor is fairly balanced with a light malt sweetness before rolling into a no-nonsense hop-bitterness that lingers with a bit of resin on the tongue. Dry finish asks for another sip. Its a little abrasive, actually, and maybe thats just what these folks need.
